titleStmt.title: An advertisement, relating to lead-sheathing in general, and particularly that upon the Worcester bound for Guinea, a ship newly sheathed, and now lying in Mr. Newman's dock in Lymehouse Hole, but goes out in two or three days time, 20 of November. 1699.
titleStmt.author: Hale, Charles, Mr.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the British Library.
